node.title: Salmon producers develop alliance to help tackle 'negative' press
node.alt: Side view of fish pen in the ocean.
node.description: Tasmania's salmon industry has weathered years of criticism, most recently from Booker-prize winning author Richard Flanagan. Now it's enlisting business leaders to fight back.Â
node.content:
["In its first unified move to counter anti-fish farm campaigns, business leaders connected to the Tasmanian salmon industry have formed an alliance to talk up its importance as an employer and a contributor to the state's economy.\u00a0", "The Spectran Group's Mark Hindmarsh does environmental monitoring for the fish farm industry and has signed up to the Tasmanian Farmed Salmon Alliance.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"I think if people took the opportunity to understand what these businesses do and how we work together to achieve the greater good there'd be a more positive outcome from it.\"\u00a0", "The alliance has been organised by Tasmania's three major salmon producers \u2014 Tassal, Huon and Petuna \u2014 and a few key stakeholders.\u00a0", "Over the last three decades the value of Tasmania's salmon industry has grown to around $1 billion and there are plans to double that by 2030.\u00a0", "But the burgeoning local sector has not been without controversy.", "In 2017, it was revealed high stocking limits at Macquarie Harbour on Tasmania's west coast had created a 'dead zone' around a Tassal lease.", "Tasmania's largest fish farmer\u00a0was forced to destock the Franklin lease and the EPA slashed the harbour's\u00a0overall stocking limit.\u00a0", "Later that year locals launched an ultimately unsuccessful campaign\u00a0to oppose new fish farming leases at Okehampton Bay on Tasmania's east coast.", "", "
Despite protests, Tassal began farming salmon at Okehampton Bay in 2017.(ABC News: Scott Ross)
", "
Alliance insists local industry is 'world class'
", "Earlier this year,\u00a0Booker Prize-winning author Richard Flanagan \u2014\u00a0who owned a shack on Bruny Island close to several fish farming leases \u2014 released the book Toxic, which\u00a0accused the industry of\u00a0polluting pristine Tasmanian waterways and the state government of regulatory failure.", "In a statement to the stock exchange in August,\u00a0Tassal conceded the book had been \"unsettling to the industry\", and in state parliament\u00a0primary industries minister Guy Barnett referred to\u00a0\"dark forces\" trying to bring the sector down.\u00a0", "John De Bruyn, general manager of logistics company De Bruyn's Transport, said a big part of the alliance's job would be highlighting the importance of the industry as a regional employer in Tasmania.\u00a0", "\"We think [the alliance] is a fantastic initiative to try and get those positive messages out\u00a0and dispel some of the misinformation,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"I've been involved in this industry for 10 years now and I've been to Norway and Canada and have done extensive research into how their industries are run.", "Mr De Bruyn said on any given day\u00a0about 20 per cent of his 250-strong labour force worked\u00a0directly in the fish farming sector \u2014 delivering fish feed to fish at sea, maintaining equipment, transporting fish around or working in the warehouse.\u00a0", "Alliance member David Whyte, who runs the BioMar fish feed production plant at Wesley Vale, said fish farming now employed\u00a0around 12,000 Tasmanians.", "\"We develop people, we skill them up and it's a fantastic and rewarding job,\" he said.\u00a0", "", "
The salmon farming industry is a major employer in regional areas like Port Huon.\u00a0(ABC News: Alexandra Humphries)
", "
Anti-fish farm campaigners urge boycott\u00a0
", "On the same day\u00a0at Hobart's Town Hall, an anti-fish farm group called Neighbours of Fish Farming launched a campaign to get Australia's major supermarkets to pull farmed Tasmanian salmon off their shelves.\u00a0", "", "
Actor Essie Davis is part of a campaign to get supermarkets to pull Tasmanian farmed salmon off their shelves.\u00a0(ABC Hobart: Joel Rheinberger)
", "The group told the gathering a petition calling for an immediate moratorium on increased production had already gathered 35,000 signatures.\u00a0", "Bruny Island resident\u00a0and\u00a0actor\u00a0Essie Davis said consumers needed to push supermarkets to change their minds about salmon.\u00a0", "\"We need to stand up and make all our voices heard around this island,\"\u00a0she said.\u00a0", "\"This is what you can do. Don't buy salmon. Tell your friends not to buy salmon. Tell restaurants and pubs and sushi bars they shouldn't have it on their menu. Because buying salmon is killing Tasmania.\""]
